com.ibm.hrl.xmleditor.extension
Interface Extension

All Known Subinterfaces:
ToolHandler, XMLExporter, XMLImporter
public interface Extension

This interface defines the methods any component hooking to Xeena should implement.

Warning: this class may not be compatible with future releases.

Method Summary
 javax.swing.Icon getIcon()
          Used to present the component via an icon in the Menu/Toolbar.
 java.lang.String getName()
          Used to present the component in the Menu/Toolbar.
 java.lang.String getToolTip()
          Used to provide a tool-tip for the component in the Menu/Toolbar.
 void init(java.lang.String _data)
          Asks the extending component to initialize itself using the data provided in the DTD configuration file.
 void setXMLEditorContext(XMLEditorContext _editorContext)
          Asks the extending component to initialize itself using the XMLEditorContext.
 

Method Detail

setXMLEditorContext

public void setXMLEditorContext(XMLEditorContext _editorContext)
Asks the extending component to initialize itself using the XMLEditorContext. It is invoked once, immediately after instantiating the class implementing this interface.
Parameters:
_editorContext - an XMLEditorContext.
See Also:
XMLEditorContext

init

public void init(java.lang.String _data)
Asks the extending component to initialize itself using the data provided in the DTD configuration file. It is invoked once immediately after invoking the method setXMLEditorContext.
Parameters:
_data - the String provided in the DTD configuration file.
See Also:
setXMLEditorContext(com.ibm.hrl.xmleditor.extension.XMLEditorContext)

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Used to present the component in the Menu/Toolbar.
Returns:
the name of the component

getToolTip

public java.lang.String getToolTip()
Used to provide a tool-tip for the component in the Menu/Toolbar. The returned value can be null, in which case no tool tip will be shown.
Returns:
a tool tip for the component

getIcon

public javax.swing.Icon getIcon()
Used to present the component via an icon in the Menu/Toolbar. The returned value can be null, in which case no icon will be shown.
Returns:
an icon representing the component
